3.2. experiments Package¶

3.2.1. diffusive Module¶

class experiments.diffusive.Diffusive(params)[source]¶

Bases: core.experiment.Experiment

Computes the analytical gaussian result for a dirac delta heat source at the fault and then computes the strain to be expected if we ignore stress and shear heating effects. This should only be used as a metric against which to make sure other experiments including more of the relevant factors are behaving correctly

Add the equaton I’m solving in MathJax.

calc_strain()[source]¶

Simply integrates the analytically derived temperature profile using a arrhenius form strain rate equation to get the strain.

plot_strain_map()[source]¶

Plots the log of the strain as a function of x and t using a colormap.

plot_temp_strainrate()[source]¶
strainrate_fnc(x, t)[source]¶
temp_fnc(x, t)[source]¶

3.2.2. fenics Module¶

3.2.3. shear_heating Module¶

class experiments.shear_heating.ShearHeating(params)[source]¶

Bases: core.experiment.Experiment

calc_strain()[source]¶

Integrates the temperature-time data to find the strain-time data. Uses simpson’s rule. ADD EQUATION THAT IT SOLVES

calc_temp()[source]¶

Runs the centered space finite difference method. This is the core method.

include_shear_heating=True implies that the shear heating term should be included.

Dirichlet boundary conditions are applied at the boundaries. The value remains equal to whatever it was in the initial conditions

ADD EQUATION THAT IT IS SOLVING in MathJax

plot_init_cond()[source]¶
plot_strain_time()[source]¶
plot_temp_time()[source]¶

3.2.4. sweep Module¶

class experiments.sweep.Sweep(sub_experiment, param_name, values)[source]¶

Bases: core.experiment.Experiment

Sweep runs another experiment multiple time with different parameter values.

By setting parallelize = True, Sweep will parallelize the loop that test all parameter values. Ensure that the experiment being tested does not parallelize already. You would get suboptimal behavior.

Currently not yet implemented.

abc()[source]¶
